overall_summary: ElizaOS is prioritizing architectural simplification in version 2.0.0 and cloud refinement while managing a critical token migration deadline on February 4th. Development highlights include the release of a Polymarket trading plugin and significant core performance optimizations in agent initialization.
key_facts: February 4th is confirmed as the official deadline for the ai16z to elizaos token migration portal closure.
Shaw released an Eliza 2.0.0 example plugin for Polymarket trading using official APIs for automated agents.
ElizaOS version 2.0 architecture now merges the planning plugin into the core, activated via the advancedPlanning flag.
Core runtime optimizations have reduced agent initialization/warm-start times by up to 40%.
Bithumb exchange has completed its ElizaOS token swap, resolving previous concerns about wallet movements.
A major strategic decision was made to deprioritize v2.0.0 work to focus exclusively on cloud infrastructure improvements.
Security improvements were implemented to prevent shell environment variables from leaking into agent secrets.
open_questions: Will plugins developed for Eliza 1.7 work natively on Eliza 2.0?
Is the GitHub tips connect wallet safe to use for contributors?
How do you fix the 'serialized message is not a function' error in Trust Wallet during migration?
Why is the builder-onboarding channel not visible to some developers?

twitter_news_highlights.claim: Multiple InfoFi crypto projects crashed after X (Twitter) announced they will no longer allow apps to reward users for posting.

new_issues_prs.title: V2.0.0
new_issues_prs.author: lalalune
new_issues_prs.significance: A major working branch for v2.0.0 that removes non-essentials and focuses the runtime on Rust and TypeScript.

new_issues_prs.title: refactor(plugin-sql): extract domain stores from BaseDrizzleAdapter
new_issues_prs.author: standujar
new_issues_prs.significance: Refactors 3,900 lines of code into composable domain stores to improve maintainability.

overall_focus.claim: Focus on core infrastructure stabilization, including WASM support proposals and parallelizing agent initialization steps to skip expensive API calls.

discord_updates.summary: Dominance of token migration support for users encountering Phantom and Trust wallet errors; community concern regarding significant market price decline.
Technical deep dive into Polymarket API legitimacy, Socket.IO server access patterns for custom plugins, and Together.ai inference integration.

user_feedback.feedback_summary: Users report Phantom wallet migration buttons are non-functional until browser cache/site data is cleared.
Core developers Express concerns about 'hiscores' naming and suggest 'character sheet' or 'rpg stats' to improve project perception.

strategic_insights.insight: The Jeju network is facing latency challenges for real-time LLMs, shifting focus toward autonomous agents and long-running asynchronous tasks that don't require immediate human response times.
implications_or_questions: Does this pivot affect the current token utility roadmap?

strategic_insights.insight: The leadership decision to prioritize cloud over the v2.0.0 branch indicates a push for immediate enterprise/hosted stability over framework-wide architectural changes.
implications_or_questions: Will this delay the community-requested features in the v2.0 monorepo?

market_analysis.observation: The project's position outside the top 200 market cap prevents automatic index-based investment flows.
market_analysis.relevance: Directly impacts liquidity and makes the project more reliant on active retail community support.
